verses.text_plain: Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;
verses.verse_html: 1Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;

tokens.text: Now it came to pass after

verses.text_plain: It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.
verses.verse_html: 2It came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a man came out of the camp from Saul with his clothes rent, and earth upon his head: and so it was, when he came to David, that he fell to the earth, and did obeisance.

tokens.text: It came even to pass on the third

verses.text_plain: And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.
verses.verse_html: 3And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.

tokens.text: unto him, Out of the camp

verses.text_plain: And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also.
verses.verse_html:
4And David said unto him, How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me. And he answered, That the people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan his son are dead also. ▼
▼ How…: Heb. What was, etc

footnotes.body_html: ▼ How…: Heb. What was, etc

verses.text_plain: And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?
verses.verse_html: 5And David said unto the young man that told him, How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan his son be dead?

verses.text_plain: And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.
verses.verse_html: 6And the young man that told him said, As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon his spear; and, lo, the chariots and horsemen followed hard after him.

verses.text_plain: And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I.
verses.verse_html:
7And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here am I. ▼
▼ Here…: Heb. Behold me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ Here…: Heb. Behold me

verses.text_plain: And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.
verses.verse_html: 8And he said unto me, Who art thou? And I answered him, I am an Amalekite.

verses.text_plain: He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me.
verses.verse_html:
9He said unto me again, Stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me: for anguish is come upon me, because my life is yet whole in me. ▼
▼ anguish…: or, my coat of mail (or, my embroidered coat) hindereth me, that my, etc

tokens.text: I pray thee, upon me, and slay

footnotes.body_text: ▼ anguish…: or, my coat of mail (or, my embroidered coat) hindereth me, that my, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ anguish…: or, my coat of mail (or, my embroidered coat) hindereth me, that my, etc

verses.text_plain: So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.
verses.verse_html: 10So I stood upon him, and slew him, because I was sure that he could not live after that he was fallen: and I took the crown that was upon his head, and the bracelet that was on his arm, and have brought them hither unto my lord.

verses.text_plain: Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:
verses.verse_html: 11Then David took hold on his clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the men that were with him:

tokens.text: them; and likewise all the men

verses.text_plain: And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the Lord, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.
verses.verse_html: 12And they mourned, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan his son, and for the people of the Lord, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

verses.text_plain: And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.
verses.verse_html: 13And David said unto the young man that told him, Whence art thou? And he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an Amalekite.

verses.text_plain: And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the Lord’s anointed?
verses.verse_html: 14And David said unto him, How wast thou not afraid to stretch forth thine hand to destroy the Lord’s anointed?

tokens.text: unto him, How wast thou not afraid

verses.text_plain: And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.
verses.verse_html: 15And David called one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. And he smote him that he died.

verses.text_plain: And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the Lord’s anointed.
verses.verse_html: 16And David said unto him, Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying, I have slain the Lord’s anointed.

verses.text_plain: And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:
verses.verse_html: 17And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan his son:

verses.text_plain: (Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.)
verses.verse_html:
18(Also he bade them teach the children of Judah the use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of Jasher.) ▼
▼ of Jasher: or, of the upright

footnotes.body_text: ▼ of Jasher: or, of the upright
footnotes.body_html: ▼ of Jasher: or, of the upright

verses.text_plain: The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!
verses.verse_html: 19The beauty of Israel is slain upon thy high places: how are the mighty fallen!

verses.text_plain: Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.
verses.verse_html: 20Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Askelon; lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph.

verses.text_plain: Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.
verses.verse_html: 21Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be rain, upon you, nor fields of offerings: for there the shield of the mighty is vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, as though he had not been anointed with oil.

verses.text_plain: From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.
verses.verse_html: 22From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty.

verses.text_plain: Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.
verses.verse_html:
23Saul and Jonathan were lovely and pleasant in their lives, and in their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions. ▼
▼ pleasant: or, sweet

verses.text_plain: Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.
verses.verse_html: 24Ye daughters of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornaments of gold upon your apparel.

verses.text_plain: How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.
verses.verse_html: 25How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! O Jonathan, thou wast slain in thine high places.

verses.text_plain: I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.
verses.verse_html: 26I am distressed for thee, my brother Jonathan: very pleasant hast thou been unto me: thy love to me was wonderful, passing the love of women.

tokens.text: hast thou been unto me: thy love

verses.text_plain: How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
verses.verse_html: 27How are the mighty fallen, and the weapons of war perished!
